keyword: how many calories in 3 scrambled eggs
title: How Many Calories in 3 Scrambled Eggs?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in 3 scrambled eggs, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown, and easy tweaks for variations.
h1: How Many Calories in 3 Scrambled Eggs?
assumptions: Large eggs (~50 g each), scrambled with 1 tsp butter or oil total and a splash of milk; no added salt or cheese.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by egg size, added fats, milk type, cooking method, and seasonings. Check labels or recipes for precision.

quick_answer.text: Three large scrambled eggs offer ~273 kcal and ~20 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

tweaks.label: No added butter or oil (plain scrambled)
Include spinach and tomatoes (1/2 cup veggies total)

faqs.q: How many calories per scrambled egg?
faqs.a: About 91 kcal for one large scrambled egg with minimal fat.

faqs.q: What is the protein in 3 scrambled eggs?
faqs.a: Approximately 20 g protein, making it a solid breakfast option.

faqs.q: Do scrambled eggs have many carbs?
faqs.a: Low carbs at ~2.7 g total for three eggs; mostly from added milk.

faqs.q: How does cooking method affect calories in scrambled eggs?
faqs.a: More butter or oil increases calories; nonstick pan with no fat reduces them.

faqs.q: Are scrambled eggs high in cholesterol?
faqs.a: Yes, ~675 mg total for three large eggs, mostly from yolks.
